Pt is 79 yo male. PMH- ischemic cardiomyopathy, CRI, DM, PVD, a-fib. He
   was Recently discharged from [**Hospital1 **] [**Location (un) **] and sent to [**Hospital **] rehab
   where pt has vagal syncopal episode where compression were done on pt
   who woke up. Temp max 103, pt sent to [**Hospital1 **] for further managaement. on
   previous admission pt DNR and refused pacemaker implantation. Pt now
   FULL CODE
   Presently the pt is alert and oriented X 3 but is noted to be forgetful
   at times and has no recollection of prior events at [**Hospital1 664**]. The pt is
   appropriate and follows commands, MAE. Pt
s LS clear bilaterally with
   diminished bases. Pox is running 96-97% on 4 liters via NC. The
   patient
s abdomen is soft with positive bowel sounds and has had a BM
   last [**6-5**]. Tolerating Pos.  The patient has a history of CRI with a
   baseline elevated Creatinine and urine output has been 15-20cc per
   hour. The patient is being treated for PNA with vancomycin and
   levofloxacin and contiunues on coumadin for a-fib. PICC line in place
   on right AC which has small amount of redness at insertion site and
   planned for continued antibiotic administration. Pt also with multiple
   skin abrasions on arms and one on left leg being dressed with DSD
   (telfa covering). The patients HR has had periods of bradycardia into
   30s as well as elevated into 150s and remains in a-fib and prior EKGs
   showing LBBB ? pacer planned. Pt
s BP now wnl running
   110s-120s/50s-60s. Has been afebrile today.
   Bacteremia
   Assessment:
   Afebrile, blood cx drawn in [**Name (NI) **], pt temp max in EW 103 and pt
   hypotensive to the 80
s systolic. T current 96. Vanc dosed in EW last
   night at 1800. AM vanc level 22.2
   Action:
   Received total of 5L overnight, currently KVO
ed taking decent amount
   of PO intake to swallow meds. WBC within normal limits. Changed ABX to
   levofloxacin and vanc. Checked vanc 24 hr trough
   Response:
   Pt afebrile , nbp 110-130 sys, vanc level 20.2
   Plan:
   Continue to assess temp, check blood cx results, follow WBC trend,
   recheck vanc trough at 0600.
   Atrial fibrillation (Afib)
   Assessment:
   Pt continues in afib with vent junct beats and pauses, hr 50
s down to
   the 30
s team is aware, asymptomatic during bradycardia.
   Action:
   Pt has pacer pads attached and monitor in room, atropine at bedside, no
   additional fluids or meds given. Coumadin as per daily dosing
   Response:
   Pt cont. in afib with pauses but heart rate increasing as shift goes
   on, currently in 70s-90s. Pt has short, self limiting burst of HR up
   into 150s which returned to back to 70s without intervention. Dr. [**First Name4 (NamePattern1) 322**]
   [**Last Name (NamePattern1) 7313**] of MICU made aware. No new orders at present. Continue to
   monitor telemetry
   Plan:
   Consult with cardiology, avoid AV nodal blocking agents while
   bradycardic
